intro: Ixora abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian flame flower, is a shrub native to Ethiopia and parts of East Africa. It is characterized by its clusters of bright red or orange flowers, which bloom throughout the year in warm climates. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and a woody stem, typical of many shrubs in the Rubiaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, making it suitable for tropical and subtropical gardens. Ixora abyssinica is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
